channel.title: Quest Interface
channel.description: Trying to make some new quests! But, I need to know how to make the interface load up when I click on the quest in the quest log. =\ Could anyone help with this?

item.title: Quest Interface
item.dc:creator: @Setsuna Setsuna
item.description:
@Setsuna wrote:

    } else if (questid == 5) {
        if (q5stage == 0) {
            sendQuest("The Gods Battle", 8135);
                    sendQuest("To do this quest I should be able to:", 8144);
                    sendQuest("Kill level 120+ Demons,", 8145);
                    sendQuest("Be good with magic,", 8147);
                    sendQuest("And not fear death...", 8148);
                    sendQuest("To start this quest talk with " + GetNpcName(77), 8149);
                    sendQuest("who can be found in the forrest", 8150);
                    sendQuest("Good luck.", 8151);
                    sendQuest("", 8152);
                    sendQuest("", 8153);
	showInterface(8134);
	flushOutStream();
        }

So something like that, then?[br][br][size=1]Posted on: March 24, 2009, 07:06:10 pm[/size][hr]No errors…But doesn’t work…[br][br][size=1]Posted on: March 24, 2009, 07:24:57 pm[/size][hr]And…Clicking the quest in the quest menu still does nothing…

Read full topic

item.title: Quest Interface
item.dc:creator: @Rich_Dude99 Rich Dude99
item.description:
@Rich_Dude99 wrote:

That code is completely wrong. Erase loadquest part, and replace with “Quest1();” And declare a method, “start quest” or something simmilar to that.

item.title: Quest Interface
item.dc:creator: @Setsuna Setsuna
item.description:
@Setsuna wrote:

    } else if (questid == 5) {
        if (q5stage == 0) {
            loadquest("The Gods Battle",
                    "To do this quest I should be able to:",
                    "Kill level 120+ Demons,",
                    "Be good with magic,",
                    "And not fear death...",
                    "To start this quest talk with " + GetNpcName(77),
                    "who can be found in the forrest", "Good luck.",
                    "", "");
        }

So what would I need to add to that, then?

item.title: Quest Interface
item.dc:creator: @Rich_Dude99 Rich Dude99
item.description:
@Rich_Dude99 wrote:

That is the scroll, what is up there is the scroll. The scroll “layout” you would be responsible for creating the seperate scrolls.

item.title: Quest Interface
item.dc:creator: @Setsuna Setsuna
item.description:
@Setsuna wrote:

Well, I believe I have the words all down:

    } else if (questid == 5) {
        if (q5stage == 0) {
            loadquest("The Gods Battle",
                    "To do this quest I should be able to:",
                    "Kill level 120+ Demons,",
                    "Be good with magic,",
                    "And not fear death...",

I think that would be them, anywho…I just need them to open up with the scroll or w/e…

Read full topic

item.title: Quest Interface
item.dc:creator: @Rich_Dude99 Rich Dude99
item.description:
@Rich_Dude99 wrote:

This will all take place in your client class. i[/i]

So declare this in your public voids:

public void Quest1() { clearQuestInterface(); sendQuest("Close Window", 8135); sendQuest("@dre@ Title Here", 8144); sendQuest("Subtitle Here", 8145); sendQuest("Line1", 8147); sendQuest("Line2", 8148); sendQuest("Line3", 8149); sendQuest("Line4", 8150); sendQuest("Line5", 8151); sendQuest("Line6", 8152); sendQuest("Line7", 8153); sendQuest("Line8", 8154); showInterface(8134); flushOutStream();

Then, I know you want quest-panel. So all you have to do, is make it on your client.java, when you click on the specific line you want (I don’t know what you want), it will have the follow code in it:

updateManual();

-Rich

Read full topic
